image.altText: A sign with LGH and emergency written on it.

props.synopsis: Survivors of alleged historical child sexual abuse at a Tasmanian hospital have received a combined $7.85 million settlement, with one claimant saying that while no money could remedy the abuse, it was "life-changing".

title.children: Survivors of paedophiles working at Tasmanian hospital receive $7.85 million compensation

image.altText: A large red and white passenger ferry in a body of water against a wintery backdrop

props.synopsis: The Spirit of Tasmania IV ferry is making its way across the North Sea to its temporary home in Scotland, but taxpayers are yet to learn how much it will cost to remain there.

title.children: As the newest Spirit of Tasmania ferry heads to its temporary home in Scotland, berthing costs remain unknown

image.altText: A colonial-looking lounge room with leather couches, a fire place and red carpet

props.synopsis: The 163-year-old Tasmanian Club has, after much fuss, voted to overturn a rule excluding women from the bar â€” but before you ladies begin queuing up for a peek inside, please note â€” you'll still need to be accompanied by a gentleman.

title.children: Women now permitted in the bar at the Tasmanian Club â€” but they have to be with a man

image.altText: A woman with long black hair and a green hoodie embraces her laughing daughter.

props.synopsis: Young mothers in Tasmania report stigma as being the hardest battle they've faced, saying the way they have been treated simply for being young and pregnant is "not OK".

title.children: 'The way that I was treatedâ€¦': Teen mums talk about the biggest issue they faced â€” society

image.altText: Large red bow on Christmas tree.

props.synopsis: The festive season can be stressful and emotionally charged, but creating new traditions and setting expectations with your core family can help manage the stress.

title.children: New traditions and setting expectations can help ease stress in the lead-up to Christmas

image.altText: The exterior of an old wooden hut surrounded by bush.

props.synopsis: Halls Hut is about as isolated as you can get in Australia's wilderness. A heli-tourism proponent will seek federal approval to fix it up, but is facing extensive opposition from bushwalkers, fly-fishers and environmental groups over the use of a helicopter.

title.children: It's a hut, on an island, in a lake, in the wilderness. Its upkeep has now become a political issue

image.altText: A member of the police force with their back to the camera approaches the driver of a white car to conduct a breath test.

props.synopsis: After being arrested the first time, the Deloraine woman was disqualified from driving for two years, but that allegedly did not stop her getting back behind the wheel again the following day.

title.children: Tasmanian woman caught driving five times over legal limit â€” twice in 12 hours

image.altText: A man wearing a beanie and wet-weather gear, seen from above, holds onto a rope while partially submerged in water.

props.synopsis: Authorities say a 65-year-old Lithuanian man who had his left leg amputated at the knee during a complex rescue operation in Tasmania's remote south-west is now in a stable condition in hospital.

title.children: Man who had leg amputated in Franklin River rescue now in a stable condition

image.altText: A woman sitting against a kitchen counter at home.

props.synopsis: Mum of two Jane Dutton has made the call to shut down her kids' social media before the ban comes into effect from the end of next year. Like many parents, she felt pressure to allow her children onto the platforms in the first place.

title.children: Did you miss? ðŸ“£ Mum who let kids onto social media so they would 'fit in' starts under-16s ban straight away

image.altText: Two men and a child walk down a street

props.synopsis: Joe Biden just broke a vow to never pardon his son. Here's why he changed his mind and how the act of clemency will impact his son and Joe Biden's political legacy.

title.children: Presidents often grant 'midnight pardons' on their final day in power. Here's why Biden wouldn't wait

image.altText: Close-up of the cocaine bricks.

props.synopsis: Police have made the largest cocaine seizure in Australian history following an investigation into a transnational organised crime syndicate accused of conspiring to import more than two tonnes of the drug into Australia.

title.children: Comanchero bikie leader charged over bungled attempt to bring 2.34 tonnes of cocaine into Australia

image.altText: Houses in Brisbane street

props.synopsis: National home prices are losing momentum, new data shows, and anticipated interest rate cuts are unlikely to stop falls in house prices next year.

title.children: 'A strain on households': Property market continues to lose steam and house price falls are expected for 2025

image.altText: A crowd of people inside a shopping centre carrying shopping bags.

props.synopsis: The ASX 200 edges higher, managing a new record. Better-than-expected retail sales figures dampen rate cut talk. Here's how the day's trade unfolded, with insights from our business reporters, on the ABC News markets blog.

title.children: Strong retail sales could keep interest rates higher for longer, ASX hits fresh record â€” as it happened

image.altText: Purga School Road on Sunday

props.synopsis: It has been the wettest November on record for parts of Queensland, but the weather bureau forecasts rain will ease after heavy falls caused flash flooding on the first weekend of summer.

title.children: Wettest November on record for parts of Queensland as rain forecast to ease after flash flooding

props.synopsis: As more cracks appear in the burgeoning super industry, performance won't take centre stage. The trust gap will.

title.children: New battleground starting to open up over superannuation

image.altText: An light-skinned Arab man in his 50s sits at a desk with Syrian Arab Republic on a placard in front of him

props.synopsis: A government counterinsurgency recaptures several towns that had been overrun in recent days by rebels, the army says, as Russian strikes kill at least 19 people.

title.children: Syrian president vows to 'crush' rebels as Russian air strikes pummel Idlib

image.altText: Great white shark

props.synopsis: A man in his 60s has been bitten by a shark off Curtis Island on the Central Queensland coast this morning, suffering lacerations to both arms.

title.children: Man rushed to hospital after shark attack off Central Queensland coast

image.altText: chihuahua sat in a trolley wearing a green shirt that says brat at new york dog parade

props.synopsis: Each year, a number of words rise above and define the feelings of so many people across the world, and each year the world's top dictionaries select a word as the best of the year.

title.children: From brat to enshittification and everything in between, these are the 2024 'words of the year'

image.altText: Michael Rowland sits on the News Breakfast couch in studio

props.synopsis: Michael Rowland has announced he's leaving ABC News Breakfast after 15 years as co-host.

title.children: Michael Rowland leaves News Breakfast after 15 years but will stay at ABC

image.altText: A Black man sits on a stage against a mostly bakcdrop with a metallic blue behind him. He looks stunned.

props.synopsis: Combs has "firmly denied" the claims in the lawsuit, which also accuses the disgraced rapper of sexual battery, infliction of emotional distress and false imprisonment.

title.children: Sean 'Diddy' Combs sued for allegedly dangling woman off a 17-storey balcony

image.altText: A man in an Australia yellow running jersey runs.

props.synopsis: Andy Buchanan, a late replacement for the Paris Olympics, took over a minute off the previous Australian Marathon record on a fast course in Valencia, while Izzi Batt-Doyle ran the third-fastest time by an Australian woman in history.

title.children: 'The guy from Bendigo that does a bit of running' smashes Australian marathon record

image.altText: Albanese sits at the centre table in parliament, frowning as he looks up from paperwork

props.synopsis: In an ominous sign for the government, new research shows dissatisfaction with the direction of the country is at the same level as it was just before the Morrison government lost the election.

title.children: A freight train of voter anger might be about to hit Albanese

image.altText: Man carries a child who is holding an umbrella on his back as he wades through flood waters in Thailand.

props.synopsis: At least 19 people have been killed and hundreds of thousands affected in Malaysia and Thailand as officials brace for the worst flood in a decade.

title.children: Death toll rises to 19 as Thailand and Malaysia face worst floods in decades

image.altText: A screenshot of the face of a man in a video.

props.synopsis: Hamas has released a video of an Israeli-American hostage in which he pleads for US President-elect Donald Trump to secure his release.

title.children: UN halts aid to Gaza after violence as hostage video released by Hamas

image.altText: A photo of residential apartments. One of them has been completely flattened by air strikes.

props.synopsis: Iran has reportedly promised to pay for the reconstruction, but unlike in 2006, Arab states have not committed funding.

title.children: Lebanese return to scenes of destruction in Beirut's suburbs as damage bill exceeds $5 billion

image.altText: A coach leads a team out for a training session

props.synopsis: Laurie Daley steered New South Wales through a difficult period and only had one series win to show for it. With the Blues legend returning as coach, he has a chance to make amends.

title.children: A second chance is a rare thing in State of Origin. What will Laurie Daley do with his?

image.altText: A police car outside a house.

props.synopsis: Police continue to investigate a fatal double shooting, which claimed the life of a 29-year-old man and an unidentified woman in the beachside town of Rye.

title.children: Suspected gunman on the run after 'targeted' shooting on Melbourne's Mornington Peninsula

image.altText: Red firecrackers go off in front of police guards.

props.synopsis: A fourth day of protests in the former Soviet republic sees thousands of protesters calling for EU membership talks to continue.

title.children: Water cannons and fireworks as Georgians protest disputed anti-EU election results

image.altText: Ambulance rushing along a road with lights on

props.synopsis: The child was taken to hospital with significant cuts to the chest and shoulder after he was attacked by an older border collie at a Townsville home.

title.children: 5yo boy suffers serious injuries after being attacked by border collie in north Queensland

image.altText: A young white boy with red hair sitting in a wheelchair smiling at an adult. They're in a school classroom

props.synopsis: Families and schools say it's more than possible to set children with disability up for success with their education. These are some of their best tips.

title.children: Whether you're a parent or educator, here's how you can set children with disability up for success at school

image.altText: Portrait of a woman with grey hair and a green dress.

props.synopsis: On Christmas Eve 1974, Theresa Roe hid in a hallway cupboard and said prayers all night while Cyclone Tracy tore her home apart around her. She was one of several thousand people who attended a 50th anniversary commemoration event over the weekend.Â

title.children: 'I thought it was the end of the world': Cyclone Tracy survivors meet and reflect, 50 years on

image.altText: A woman looks away.

props.synopsis: New legislation gives Belgian sex workers the right to refuse clients, access unemployment support and mandates sweeping safety protocols for employers.

title.children: Sex workers in Belgium receive fundamental labour rights in world-first 'revolution'

image.altText: A man sitting at a drum kit takes a selfie on stage in front of thousands of people

props.synopsis: A Queensland man had the experience of a lifetime after being invited to play on stage alongside The Killers in a stadium packed with 18,000 people.

title.children: Mackay drum teacher plucked from crowd to rock out with The Killers in stadium show
